intro: Carpesium thunbergianum, commonly known as the Japanese marguerite, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has serrated, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Carpesium thunbergianum is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
